boone.util

Class ExceptionHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • boone.util.ExceptionHandler

  • public class ExceptionHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    Handle a Boone exception. This is a central place where exceptions occurring during running the neural net are reported. Most of the time, the network should just continue working, and not even print the exception, but it is important that somehow, the user can retrieve those things.

    If an Exception should be raised nonetheless, we could raise a new RuntimeException.

    Attention: Attacks are possible, if the location contains strings that were acquired from the outside (think terminal escape scripts).

    Version:
    $Id: ExceptionHandler.java 911 2004-08-04 10:51:16Z amayer $
    Author:
    August Mayer

    • Method Detail

      • handle

        public static void handle(java.lang.Throwable t,
                          java.lang.String location)
        Handle an exception, generically. This method forwards the call to the ExeptionHandler's default handler instance.
        Parameters:
        t - An Exception that should be publicized somehow, but is then ignored.
        location - Some description of the location where the Exception occurred. As the method name is already stored in the backtrace, some more exact description is needed.

      • setDefaultHandler

        public static void setDefaultHandler(ExceptionHandler handler)
        Set the default exception handler.

      • getDefaultHandler

        public static ExceptionHandler getDefaultHandler()
        Return the default exception handler.

      • handleException

        public void handleException(java.lang.Throwable t,
                            java.lang.String location)
        Default implementation: Just print the text to System.err .
        Parameters:
        t - An Exception that should be publicized somehow, but is then ignored.
        location - Some description of the location where the Exception occurred. As the method name is already stored in the backtrace, some more exact description is needed.
